howItWorks.content: Once injected, PRP releases growth factors that instruct the body to heal. Platelets activate fibroblasts, stimulate angiogenesis, and encourage nerve sprouting. That means more circulation, thicker tissue, and heightened responsiveness.

faq.question: How soon can I be intimate after the O-Shot?
faq.answer: Immediately. Some women prefer to wait 24 hours if there is mild swelling, but it's safe to resume the same day. Most women are pleasantly surprised by how quick recovery is.

faq.question: Is the O-Shot painful?
faq.answer: Topical anaesthetic, vibration therapy, and optional nitrous oxide keep discomfort to a mild pressure sensation. Most women rate it 2/10 for discomfort—much less than expected.

faq.question: How long do O-Shot results last?
faq.answer: Most patients enjoy 12-18 months of results. We offer booster sessions annually if you'd like to maintain peak sensation and lubrication. Many women make it part of their yearly wellness routine.

faq.question: How much does the O-Shot cost in London?
faq.answer: The O-Shot Signature is £1,150. The O-Shot + Ultra Femme 360 package is £1,950 (save £350). The O-Shot + EMSELLA Boost is £2,150 (save £250). Consultation fee (£100) is credited toward treatment. 0% finance available.

faq.question: How many O-Shot treatments do I need?
faq.answer: Most women achieve excellent results with a single treatment. Optional boosters at 12-18 months maintain peak benefits. Some women with severe concerns benefit from a second treatment at 3 months.

faq.question: Can I combine the O-Shot with HRT?
faq.answer: Yes. PRP is compatible with hormone replacement therapy and actually complements it well. We coordinate with your prescribing doctor if needed to optimize your full treatment plan.

faq.question: Does the O-Shot help lichen sclerosus?
faq.answer: PRP reduces inflammation and improves tissue integrity when paired with LED therapy and custom barrier care. Many women with lichen sclerosus find significant symptom relief.

faq.question: Do you offer payment plans for the O-Shot?
faq.answer: Yes—0% finance over 6-12 months, arranged during consultation. We want treatments to be accessible. Consultation fee is credited toward treatment.

longDescription: The O-Shot® harnesses platelet-rich plasma (PRP) from your own blood to regenerate the clitoral network, anterior vaginal wall (G-spot), labia, and periurethral tissue. Concentrated growth factors trigger angiogenesis, collagen production, and nerve sprouting so arousal, lubrication, and orgasm return naturally.\n\nEvery appointment at Dr. SNA Clinic is private, doctor-led, and tailored around your hormonal stage—whether you are postnatal, perimenopausal, or simply seeking amplified sensation. Optional chaperones and comfort protocols (topical numbing, vibration analgesia, nerve blocks) ensure the experience is calm from start to finish.

overview.title: What Is the O-Shot?
highlights: Targets nerves, blood flow, and tissue tone simultaneously
Comfort-first visit with optional female chaperone
Pairs perfectly with Ultra Femme 360 or EMSELLA
overview.content: We draw a small sample of blood, concentrate the platelets using a dual-spin centrifuge, and re-inject this ‘liquid gold’ into the clitoris, anterior vaginal wall, labia, and periurethral sling. Growth factors such as PDGF, VEGF, IGF, and TGF-β stimulate collagen, nerves, and micro-circulation so arousal and lubrication feel effortless again. Because PRP is autologous, there is virtually zero risk of allergic reaction.

quickStats.anesthesia: Topical numbing + vibration analgesia (optional nerve block)
quickStats.sessions: Single treatment; optional booster at 9-12 months

title: O-Shot® (PRP Shot for Women)

seo.metaDescription: Experience the O-Shot in London with Dr. SNA Clinic. £1,150 treatment to restore lubrication, orgasm, and bladder control. Doctor-led, zero downtime.

schema.howPerformed: After 20 minutes of topical numbing, we draw 10ml of blood from your arm. This spins in a dual-centrifuge for 8 minutes, separating golden platelet-rich plasma from red blood cells. Using ultra-fine needles, we inject the concentrated PRP into precise points: around the clitoral complex to enhance nerve response, into the G-spot area for improved sensation and lubrication, along delicate vestibular tissue to thicken fragile skin, and around the urethra to support bladder control. Vibration devices and optional nitrous oxide (laughing gas) keep you comfortable throughout. The whole process takes 45 minutes from door to door
schema.preparation: Stay well-hydrated for 48 hours before. Shave or trim if you prefer, but not required. Shower beforehand. Wear comfortable, loose clothing. Avoid alcohol 24 hours before. Come on an empty bladder. If prone to anxiety, consider bringing headphones with calming music. Most importantly, come with an open mind—this treatment is clinical, dignified, and surprisingly comfortable
schema.followup: Resume all activities immediately, including intimacy if desired (most women prefer to wait 24 hours). Mild swelling or warmth for 24 hours is normal. Avoid hot baths or saunas for 24 hours. No tampons for 3 days (pads okay). Stay well-hydrated to support tissue healing. Most women notice improved lubrication within 2-3 weeks. Sensation and orgasm quality improve over 4-8 weeks as nerve sprouting occurs
schema.outcome: Within weeks, lubrication returns naturally—no more discomfort or dryness. Orgasms become easier to achieve, stronger, and more reliable. Many women report multiple orgasms for the first time. Bladder control improves for mild stress incontinence. Thin, painful tissue thickens and heals. Intimacy becomes pleasurable again. Confidence soars. Results last 12-18 months, then you can repeat treatment to maintain these benefits
schema.medicationRequired: Topical numbing cream (lidocaine). Optional nitrous oxide (laughing gas) for anxious patients. Optional nerve block for extra comfort
schema.treatmentFrequency: Single treatment lasting 12-18 months. Many women choose annual boosters to maintain peak sensation. Can be combined with Ultra Femme or EMSELLA for comprehensive rejuvenation
schema.adverseOutcome: Mild swelling or warmth for 24 hours (ice packs help). Possible small bruise at injection sites. Temporary increased sensitivity for 48 hours. Very rarely, infection (we use strict sterile technique)
contraindication: Taking blood thinners (warfarin) without medical clearance
Severe vaginal atrophy requiring estrogen therapy first
typicalTest: Pelvic examination to assess tissue quality
Discussion of sexual health and concerns
Medical history including hormones and medications
Blood test if platelet disorder suspected
clinicalFindings: Low libido or difficulty achieving orgasm
Mild stress urinary incontinence (leaks with coughing/laughing)
Lichen sclerosis symptoms (when combined with LED therapy)
Desire for natural, hormone-free intimate rejuvenation
